intro: Gymnadenia prasina, commonly known as the green gentian, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its tall, erect stems and showy blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist meadows, woodlands, and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged in a basal rosette, and it produces a single spike of flowers at the top of the stem. Gymnadenia prasina is known for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in gardens for its striking blooms.
